text.p: These are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Malta, Sicily in talks on tourism, air and sea transport, sports and cultural exchanges.
- Construction worker dies in crane accident, the third industrial accident this year.

- European Union is planning a second Oavis study on Malta, Foreign Minister George Vella says. The Oavis is a study drawn by the European Commission to assess and recommend changes for applicant countries to be in a position to comply with the union's regulations. The present government has frozen Malta's application to join the union.

- Opposition leader says proposed new system of indirect taxation will negatively affect workers. Fenech Adami told trade unionists that the new system to replace VAT could push up the cost of living and reduce government revenue.
